Now, let‚Äôs get it passed into law!

My Prison Libraries Act would provide grant funding to increase the capacity for libraries in correctional facilities, offer library resources dedicated to education and job training, invest in updated materials and equipment, and hire qualified staff to manage prison libraries.

Access to library resources are proven to improve educational opportunities and reintegration efforts while reducing recidivism for incarcerated Americans‚Äîall of which helps keep our communities safe and decreases the taxpayer cost of incarceration.

With 600,000 individuals released from federal and state prisons each year, it is imperative that we focus on the rehabilitation of incarcerated Americans, and library resources can play a pivotal role in that process.

Libraries play an essential role in our communities, providing entertainment, equitable access to information, & additional opportunities for all who use them‚Äîbut it is critically important that we ensure library services are also available in correctional facilities nationwide.

As we celebrate National Library Week and all the benefits libraries offer, I‚Äôm proud to introduce my Prison Libraries Act with @JacksonLeeTX18 and @RepShontelBrown to expand library resources in correctional facilities across the country.
